channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: French voters push far-right National Rally to strong lead in first round of elections
item.description: The far-right National Rally leaped into a strong lead in France's first round of legislative elections, pollers projected, bringing the party closer to being able to form a government in round two.
item.content:encoded:
The far-right National Rally leaped into a strong lead in France's first round of legislative elections, pollers projected, bringing the party closer to being able to form a government in round two.

(Image credit: Thibault Camus)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In historic court-martial, an Air Force general was found not guilty of sexual assault
item.description: Maj. Gen. Phillip Stewart has been found not guilty of sexual assault of a female officer in his former command in a historic court-martial at Fort Sam Houston.
item.content:encoded: Maj. Gen. Phillip Stewart has been found not guilty of sexual assault of a female officer in his former command in a historic court-martial at Fort Sam Houston.
item.dc:creator: Gabriella Alcorta-Solorio

item.title: 10 years on, why is the Eiffel Tower of Miami project still stalled?
item.description: Ten years ago, developers said they'd build one of the tallest buildings in the world, calling it the Eiffel Tower of Miami. But all that's there today is a trash-laden empty waterfront lot.
item.content:encoded: Ten years ago, developers said they'd build one of the tallest buildings in the world, calling it the Eiffel Tower of Miami. But all that's there today is a trash-laden empty waterfront lot.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Rivero

item.title: After shaky presidential debate performance, what comes next for concerned Democrats?
item.description: Days after the first presidential debate, President Biden's campaign is still trying to tamp out suggestions that he should drop out of the race.
item.content:encoded: Days after the first presidential debate, President Biden's campaign is still trying to tamp out suggestions that he should drop out of the race.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: The Bigfoot Festival draws thousands to West Virginia
item.description: The Bigfoot Festival in West Virginia draws people in search of the elusive creature that lives on in local folklore.
item.content:encoded: The Bigfoot Festival in West Virginia draws people in search of the elusive creature that lives on in local folklore.
item.dc:creator: Briana Heaney

item.title: What we know about the fatal police shooting of a 13-year-old boy in Utica, N.Y
item.description: Police said they believed that Nyah Mway brandished a weapon after running away from three officers who were investigating a string of recent robberies. Authorities later said it was a pellet gun.
item.content:encoded:
Police said they believed that Nyah Mway brandished a weapon after running away from three officers who were investigating a string of recent robberies. Authorities later said it was a pellet gun.

(Image credit: Hans Pennink)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump team plans to pare down Republican Party platform ahead of convention
item.description: A memo obtained by NPR says the campaign wants a streamlined platform to keep a focused message. In an attempt to tamp down controversy, they also plan to sort the language behind closed doors.
item.content:encoded:
A memo obtained by NPR says the campaign wants a streamlined platform to keep a focused message. In an attempt to tamp down controversy, they also plan to sort the language behind closed doors.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: A 'honey bear' was spotted in Washington state, 2000 miles north of its habitat
item.description: A wandering kinkajou, a small mammal that lives in the rainforests of Mexico and Central and South America, was spotted outside of Yakima, Washington.
item.content:encoded: A wandering kinkajou, a small mammal that lives in the rainforests of Mexico and Central and South America, was spotted outside of Yakima, Washington.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Tips to deal with cicada song, for those with sensory issues
item.description: Cicadas make noise — and it can be difficult for children with autism and others with sensory issues to deal with. Educators, parents and scientists give some ideas for coping with the cacophony.
item.content:encoded: Cicadas make noise — and it can be difficult for children with autism and others with sensory issues to deal with. Educators, parents and scientists give some ideas for coping with the cacophony.
item.dc:creator: Zach Dyer

item.title: Supreme Court blocks opioid settlement with Purdue Pharma that shielded Sacklers
item.description: We look at the Supreme Court decision to throw out a multi-billion dollar bankruptcy deal involving the makers of Oxycontin, that would've shielded the owners of Purdue Pharma from civil lawsuits.
item.content:encoded: We look at the Supreme Court decision to throw out a multi-billion dollar bankruptcy deal involving the makers of Oxycontin, that would've shielded the owners of Purdue Pharma from civil lawsuits.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann
